alert.note: Alert for Coles; Moultrie; Shelby (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 29 at 10:41PM CDT until August 30 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT TUESDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN MOULTRIE, EAST CENTRAL SHELBY AND COLES COUNTIES... At 1037 PM CDT, emergency management reported flash flooding across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Multiple water rescues have been reported to be ongoing in Mattoon for vehicles stranded in deep flood water. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Charleston, Mattoon, Shelbyville, Oakland, Ashmore, Windsor, Lerna, Janesville, Rardin, Coles, Paradise, Hutton, Gays, Coles County Airport, Trilla, Etna, Fairgrange, Fox Ridge State Park, Bushton and Wolf Creek State Park. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
